value.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure compute options
value.excerpt: Review the Azure compute services and explore how they can solve common business needs.

images.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure compute options

value.title: Architect message brokering and serverless applications in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to create reliable messaging for your applications, and how to take advantage of serverless application services in Azure.

topItems.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
topItems.excerpt: Azure Functions allow developers to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning infrastructure.

images.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions

topItems.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Define a workflow using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators. Your workflow will run automatically when data is available, process the data in the cloud, record results in a database, and send email notifications.

images.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: When you have an application that consists of components running on different computers, servers, and mobile devices, reliable communications between those components can be difficult and unreliable. Azure provides several technologies that you can use to communicate more reliably, including Storage queues, Event Hubs, Event Grid, and Service Bus. This module shows you how to choose the best technology for your communication task.

images.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Implement the publish-subscribe pattern in the cloud using Azure Queue storage.

images.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage

value.title: Create serverless applications learning path
value.excerpt: In this learning path, discover Azure Functions that create event-driven, compute-on-demand systems using server-side logic to build serverless architectures.

topItems.title: Choose the best Azure service to automate your business processes
topItems.excerpt: Microsoft Azure provides several different ways to host and execute code or workflows without using Virtual Machines (VMs) including Azure Functions, Microsoft Power Automate, Azure Logic Apps, and Azure WebJobs. In this module, you will learn about these technologies and how to choose the right one for a given scenario.

images.title: Choose the best Azure service to automate your business processes

topItems.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
topItems.excerpt: Azure Functions allow developers to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning infrastructure.

images.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions

topItems.title: Execute an Azure Function with triggers
topItems.excerpt: A trigger is responsible for executing an Azure function and there are dozens of triggers to choose from. This module will you show you some of the most common types of triggers and how to configure them to execute your logic.

images.title: Execute an Azure Function with triggers

topItems.title: Chain Azure Functions together using input and output bindings
topItems.excerpt: Integrate data sources with your Azure Functions serverless logic by using bindings.

images.title: Chain Azure Functions together using input and output bindings
Choose the best Azure service to automate your business processes

value.title: Create serverless applications
value.excerpt: Azure Functions enable the creation of event driven, compute-on-demand systems that can be triggered by various external events. Learn how to leverage functions to execute server-side logic and build serverless architectures.

value.title: AZ-400: Develop an instrumentation strategy
value.excerpt:
Learn how logging, telemetry, and monitoring give you full visibility into what's happening in your environment.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging
topItems.excerpt: Use application logs in Azure Web Apps to help debug web app code.

images.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging

topItems.title: Control and organize Azure resources with Azure Resource Manager
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Resource Manager to organize resources, enforce standards, and protect critical assets from deletion.

images.title: Control and organize Azure resources with Azure Resource Manager

topItems.title: Introduction to App Center
topItems.excerpt: Characterize the types of services offered by App Center. Describe the use of App Center to build, distribute, test, and analyze usage of apps.

images.title: Introduction to App Center

topItems.title: Azure Spring Cloud workshop
topItems.excerpt: In this workshop, you'll go through tasks to deploy Spring Boot microservices to Azure Spring Cloud (ASC).

images.title: Azure Spring Cloud workshop

value.title: Create a long-running serverless workflow with Durable Functions
value.excerpt: Learn how to orchestrate a long-running workflow as a set of activities using Durable Functions.

images.title: Create a long-running serverless workflow with Durable Functions

value.title: Expose multiple Azure Function apps as a consistent API by using Azure API Management
value.excerpt: Combine multiple Azure Functions apps into a unified interface by importing them into a single Azure API Management instance.

images.title: Expose multiple Azure Function apps as a consistent API by using Azure API Management

value.title: Execute an Azure Function with triggers
value.excerpt: A trigger is responsible for executing an Azure function and there are dozens of triggers to choose from. This module will you show you some of the most common types of triggers and how to configure them to execute your logic.

images.title: Execute an Azure Function with triggers

value.title: Develop, test, and publish Azure Functions by using Azure Functions Core Tools
value.excerpt: Use the Azure Functions Core Tools to create and run functions on a development computer and publish them to Azure.

images.title: Develop, test, and publish Azure Functions by using Azure Functions Core Tools

value.title: Chain Azure Functions together using input and output bindings
value.excerpt: Integrate data sources with your Azure Functions serverless logic by using bindings.

images.title: Chain Azure Functions together using input and output bindings

value.title: Discover sentiment in text with the Text Analytics API
value.excerpt: Learn what your customers are really saying about your product or brand when they send feedback. We'll create a solution that uses Azure Functions and the intelligence of the Text Analytics API to discover sentiment in text messages.

images.title: Discover sentiment in text with the Text Analytics API

value.title: Monitor GitHub events by using a webhook with Azure Functions
value.excerpt: Webhooks offer a lightweight mechanism for your app to be notified by another service when something of interest happens. In this module. you'll learn how to trigger an Azure function with a GitHub webhook and parse the payload for insights.

images.title: Monitor GitHub events by using a webhook with Azure Functions

value.title: Enable automatic updates in a web application using Azure Functions and SignalR Service
value.excerpt: Update a web app's notification mechanism from polling to push-based architecture with SignalR Service, Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Functions.

value.title: Develop, test, and deploy an Azure Function with Visual Studio
value.excerpt: Create test and deploy Azure Functions using Visual studio and how to manage Azure Function code.

images.title: Develop, test, and deploy an Azure Function with Visual Studio

value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Performance efficiency
value.excerpt: Scaling your system to handle load, identifying network bottlenecks, and optimizing your storage performance are important to ensure your users have the best experience. Learn how to make your application perform at its best.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Performance efficiency

value.title: Develop an App using the Maven Plugin for Azure Functions
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the Maven Plugin for Azure Functions to create a cloud-based function that is triggered when values are passed in the HTTP request, and outputs a log entry to track the activity.

value.title: Decompose a monolithic application into a microservices architecture
value.excerpt: Improve development agility, deployment, fault tolerance, and scalability by modernizing your application with a microservices architecture.

images.title: Decompose a monolithic application into a microservices architecture

images.title: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app and API with Azure Static Web Apps

value.title: Share your location as a text message using Azure Functions and Twilio
value.excerpt: Learn how to use location tracking on your phone mixed with Azure Functions and Twilio to share your location with your friends as a text message.

images.title: Share your location as a text message using Azure Functions and Twilio

value.title: Refactor Node.js and Express APIs to Serverless APIs with Azure Functions
value.excerpt: Refactor Node.js and Express APIs from a server-based architecture to serverless APIs with Azure Functions.

value.title: The Mojifier - Create a Slack bot that replaces people's faces with emojis matching their emotion
value.excerpt: Learn how to get images, calculate emotion, match emotions to emojis, and replace faces with emoji.
